Title: CCTV Control Room Move and System Upgrade
Description:
Swale Borough Council is inviting Expressions of Interest to tender for its CCTV Control Room move and CCTV system upgrade.

The contract will commence on Thursday, 09 January 2020 and terminate on Friday, 31 March 2023.  The Council may extend this opportunity for a further two years  The tenderer/s who submits the Most Economically Advantageous Tender, (MEAT) will be awarded the contract.

The contract will involve  creating a new CCTV Control Room within the Sittingbourne Multi-Storey Car Park; upgrading all existing CCTV camera sites to digital; implementing a wireless infrastructure for all three town centres covered by CCTV; a years defect period; and a 2 years maintenance period.

Expressions of Interest and Invitation to Tender (I.T.T.) must be submitted / uploaded on the Council's e-tendering portal.

The closing date for submissions of Expressions of Interest and the closing date for the I.T.T. will be 17/10/2019 09:55.

Title: Provision of a Fuel Management Information System for the 2 Gp Air Mobility Force (AMF) HQ Fuel Management Cell at RAF Brize Norton
Description: 2 Gp require a fully operational, proven and accredited FMIS (Fuel Management Information System) software solution to enable the collation and analysis of 2 Gp aviation fuel data parameters in order to drive mandated AMF HQ fuel saving initiatives.  A FMIS is required to enable AMF HQ to track and measure performance against identified initiatives in order to reduce the delta between resourced, planned and actual expenditure on 2 Gp aviation fuel. Industry Best Practice within the Airline Industry states that FMISs are part of every Fuel Efficiency programme and are used to provide an evidential base to support fuel saving, maintenance planning and carbon emissions reduction across the business.  They comprise software designed to collect, analyse and present fuel data; with some FMIS service providers offering engine or flight planning synergies to maximise further saving potential.
Contact Address 1: RAF High Wycombe, Nimrod Building, 3 Site

Site preparation, ground works, foundations, utilities installation, and landscaping of sites, and the assembly and erection of modular housing (made by others), and later dismantling, relocation and re-erection of the same.

Title: Skid Resistance Contracts Finder Award Notice
Description:
Five contracts have been awarded for specialist technical support to provide regional routine annual skid resistance surveys. Sideways-force coefficient routine investigation machine surveys are Highways England's method of assessing and monitoring skid resistance in accordance with the Design Manual for Roads and Bridges (DMRB) standard HD28/CS228.

The strategic road network is surveyed annually to assess skid resistance. The results identify any sites with abnormally low skid resistance which are subsequently investigated and prioritised for remedial work, if required.

There are five lots split into four regions and one lot of Benchmark sites. The regional lots are outlined below:
Lot 1 - South West, Area 3 and the Second Severn Crossing
Lot 2 - Area 4, Area 6, Area 8 and the M25 DBFO
Lot 3 - Area 7, Area 9 and the A1DD
Lot 4 - Area 10, Area 12, Area 13 and Area 14.
Lot 5 - Outlined in the Scope document.

The boundaries for all lots are as defined in the procurement documents.

The Contracts are for a period of three years with an option to extend for up to a further two years (5 years total).
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,South East,South West

Organisation Name: West Midlands Fire and Rescue Authority
Title: Framework Agreement For Supply and Delivery of Oriented Strand Board for UK Fire Services and their Agents
Description:
West Midlands Fire & Rescue Authority are establishing a framework agreement for the Supply & Delivery of Oriented Strand Board for training use over a period of four years. The framework could be accessed by UK Fire & Rescue Services (FRS) and their agents via further competition 
A directory listing potential FRS customers can be located here: https://www.nationalfirechiefs.org.uk/Fire-and-Rescue-Services  
The Framework Agreement will also be available for Participating Customers (agents) who are other bodies associated with FRS activities with similar requirements (also any new or successor Agent).  Agents may only use the framework for FRS activities.  (See ITT for detail).
This multi-supplier Framework Agreement will be divided into 12 regional Lots. (see App 4 for Lot info). Economic Operators can bid for one or more lots.
Economic Operators should have/be prepared to obtain £5m public, £5 product & £5m employer's liability & prove their financial stability. OSB must be formaldehyde low or free & be sustainably sourced, refer to tender documents for full detail. 
The anticipated value of the supply of the framework could be between £0 & £4.5m although the Authority does not guarantee any business. 
Contract award/start is expected to be December 2019 (subject to contract). 
Economic Operators who meet the mandatory requirements in the Selection Questionnaire will have their technical questions and pricing evaluated. 
To be considered for this contract please download, complete and return the tender documentation for this opportunity via the EU Supply portal, which can be located by clicking and following this link: 
https://bluelight.eu-supply.com
If you are not registered you must register before your response can be submitted. Registration can be completed via the EU Supply homepage 'Supplier Registration' tab. 
Closing date and time for applications is 4-Nov-19, 15:00hrs. Applications that are not uploaded to EU Supply by the deadline won't be considered.

Title: PEDPS Contract 17385 HES Prison Group IAG 2020-2021
Description:
The IAG service will provide accurate and impartial information, advice and guidance to help prisoners make decisions on their journey through their sentence. It will provide guidance on the learning, training and work opportunities available whilst in custody and upon release.  The key outcomes of the service are expected to reduce reoffending by: 

-	Supply a service which is confidential to the individual, and which meets the highest standards of equality of opportunity.
-	Alignment of prisoners PLP (Personal Learning Plan) & individual learning whilst in custody.
-	Supporting and advocating basic English and Mathematics development.
-	Provide accurate and impartial information, advice and guidance to both prisoners and potential employers about the education courses, qualifications and training services provided within the Prison.
-	Provide a service that conforms to the standards laid down by Matrix. Staff will be qualified to at least a level 3 award in careers information, advice and guidance.
-	Transferring individuals to the through the gate National Careers Service in community to ensure continuity of service on release and to support their progression into learning and employment  
-	Providing continuity of Service Inspiration, Employer Engagement activity for prisoners whilst in custody and on release to aid their progression opportunities  
-	Suppliers will be expected to use digital platforms to enhance the learner's experience, i.e. use of the Virtual Campus, Passport 2 Employment, Gov.uk.
-	Suppliers will also be expected to work closely with other services and agencies including DWP Work Coach, CFO3 providers, New Futures Network Employment Brokers, CRC's etc. 
-	Suppliers will need to be able to offer a bespoke service aligned with the needs according to the role of each of the prisons.

Organisation Name: Homes England (the name adopted by the Homes and Communities Agency)
Title: Homes England - MD Panel - MMC Pilot Site Research Commission - National Portfolio
Description:
Homes England wants to provide a body of verifiable data on the performance of different types of Modern Methods of Construction (MMC). At present there is not enough impartial information widely available to give the industry the confidence to widely increase the uptake of MMC. To remedy this Homes England is encouraging developers to commit to advanced levels of MMC on eight sites totalling almost 1,500 homes. As a condition of the development of this land we are mandating that the sites will have to be subject to research and performance monitoring to understand the benefits (and the potential draw backs) of delivering housing using different types of MMC technology.   
This study will provide a body of research which can answer the questions frequently asked by housebuilders, contractors, commissioners, financers, insurers, etc... as regards issues such as cost of delivery, the energy performance of MMC homes, the prevalence of delivery defects, material wastage levels, etc... by monitoring the projects from foundations through to one-year post occupancy.  
This data and analysis needs to be in a format that can be readily shared with industry, local & national government and other interested parties to provide clear evidence on how MMC performs against traditional build.  It is intended that this landmark study provides a template for how the industry and other partners can measure the performance of MMC in the future, creating a substantial body of data and encouraging the uptake of MMC more widely. 
Beyond measuring the physical benefits of MMC, Homes England would also like to analyse the costs and monetised benefits in order to better understand the economic rationale for MMC.

Title: Market Research Services
Description:
Market Research is commissioned for a variety of purposes within the BBC, across the full range of different audiences for its programmes and services. The research will inform strategic policy, commissioning and editorial decisions as well as ensuring audiences are at the heart of everything the BBC delivers therefore we are looking to appoint a range of agencies that can meet the BBC's requirements across all platforms and target audiences. The BBC also has a clear strategy to engage with and target youth audiences, reflecting the changing nature on how content is discovered and consumed by the next generation of our audience.

Please note that the OJEU value range for this procurement is £30,000,000 - £50,000,000 over the term plus extensions.
Contact Address 1: BC0 B1-D1 Broadcast Centre, White City Place, 201 Wood Lane
Additional Text:
Contracts have been awarded to 36 service providers across 5 individual lots. 

For further information please contact Hannah Stephenson at hannah.stevenson@bbc.co.uk, or refer to the published Contract Award Notice in OJEU/TED at https://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:055381-2020:TEXT:EN:HTML

Title: Housing First in Hackney
Description: A contract to deliver the Housing First model of accommodation provision. Housing First is a method of supporting entrenched rough sleepers with complex needs who have not achieved recovery in traditional hostel provision.  Housing First offers independent accommodation first, allowing clients to engage with support when they choose.

Title: GB-High Wycombe: 26-28 White Hart Street
Description: Refurbishment of the premises at 26 -28 White Hart Street, High Wycombe to create a ground floor café and 1st floor office space. The works will include, but are not limited to, new electrical and mechanical services, new cladding and external decorations, fitting of internal security shutters to the ground floor facade, re-roofing to include the replacement of existing roof lights, minor structural repairs, drainage repairs, drylining and partitions, internal finishes and landlord fit-out.
Additional Text: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

Title: Fusion21 Heating & Renewables Framework
Description: Fusion21 has developed a Framework for the full provision of heating works across public sector estates, the scope of the Framework also includes heating related renewable technologies. The Framework is broken down over 10 separate Lots which include: 1. Domestic Servicing, Maintenance and Installation of Heating Systems; 2. Domestic Heating Installations; 3. Commercial Servicing, Maintenance and Installation of Heating Systems; 4. Commercial Heating Installations; 5. Quality Assurance & Asset Management Consultancy; 6. Principal Design & Project Management Consultancy; 7. Installation of Air and Ground Source Heat Pumps; 8. Installation of Solar Heating Systems; 9. Installation of Electric Heating Systems; and 10. Department for Education / Education Heating Programmes.

Title: Latch House
Description:
Invitation to tender for the Provision of An Offender Supported Housing Project

The London Borough of Lambeth wishes to offer an opportunity to tender for the provision of a 15 bed, male offender hostel in the borough.

The service will support the approach and the priorities of the Vulnerable Adults Housing Pathway.

The contract will be let for an initial period of 3 years, anticipated to commence in April 2020 with an option to extend for 2 years on an annual basis. The service may have scope to provide additional/complementary services. This may be by way of contract variation. The successful service provider must demonstrate their ability to:

•	Deliver a service that works with people with complex offending and substance use support needs 
•	Develop a suitably skilled staff team 
•	Provide a high quality, personalised service in an effective and efficient manner in accordance with good practice
•	Deliver services in partnership with key statutory and voluntary sector organisations, operating within a multi-disciplinary and multicultural environment 

The Council welcomes applicants from within the voluntary, charity and social enterprise sectors as well as consortiums and is particularly keen to promote local opportunities to local organisations.

It is a prerequisite that organisations wishing to provide service for the council must go through the council's pre-qualification process.  

The full proposal summary for this service can be accessed via current tender opportunities through the following link:

Title: Assessing Climate Change Mitigation Options for the Authority's International Climate Finance (ICF) Portfolio
Description:
The purpose of this research is to directly support the Authority and wider Government in designing, planning and implementing new climate finance programming for a doubling of UK climate finance, and to contribute to the International Climate Finance evidence base by way of an up to date assessment of developing country (defined as Official Development Assistance (ODA) -eligible by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)) priority mitigation opportunities (for example opportunities by sector, sub-sector, technology, or theme). Organisation Name: CTM Portal for the NDA Shared Services Alliance
Title: Carbon-14 Release of Irradiated AGR Graphite
Description: RWM wishes to commission a study to measure and further understand the release of carbon-14 from irradiated graphite under a range of relevant conditions. This will involve measurement of total carbon-14 release into the gas and aqueous phases during leaching in an appropriate solution, together with characterisation of the composition. Specifically, this study would investigate the release of carbon-14 from Advanced Gas-cooled Reactor (AGR) graphite and compare to the previous results obtained from WAGR, BEP0 and Magnox graphite. This will require an experimental programme that closely follows the methods and test durations previously studied for Magnox graphite to provide comparable results. RWM request that the contractor propose a baseline schedule based on a total leaching duration of 24 months, with appropriate scheduled sampling intervals. RWM also request that schedules based on 36 and 48 month leaching durations are also included as optional tasks/extensions, that would allow the leaching to be extended if the results towards the end of 24 months warrant further experimental studies.

Notice Identifier: UK SBS PR19131 FREIA CHOPPER SYSTEM DISC ASSEMBLIES
Title: UK SBS PR19131 FREIA CHOPPER SYSTEM DISC ASSEMBLIES
Description:
***PLEASE NOTE THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION*** UK Research and Innovation had a requirement to purchase Freia Chopper System Disc Assemblies. The Contract was awarded following a negotiated procedure without prior publication, in accordance with Regulation 32 (2) (a) (b) (ii) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

Award of a contract without prior publication of a call for competition in the Official Journal of the European Union in the cases listed below :

•	No tenders or no suitable tenders/requests to participate in response to open procedure
•	The works, supplies or services can be provided only by a particular economic operator for the following reason:
•	absence of competition for technical reasons

Explanation:
The neutron choppers that will be used in FREIA system are bespoke and have specific technical requirements as the discs are larger than conventional discs with complex geometric design. The proposed material composition of these discs must provide the required performance and meet the technical specifications. Currently there is no other supplier other than Airbus who has the technical capability and resources to carry out designing and manufacturing these unique neutron choppers.

Title: Investment Manager for Endowment Funds - AWARD
Description:
The University of Reading has a number of endowment assets held across a variety of classes, including agricultural land and investment properties, as well as more traditional endowment funds.  The total amount held within these endowment funds (mainly equities and bonds) totalled £122.8m at 31 July 2019.     
      
      The University of Reading and its associated Trusts and subsidiaries (the "University Group"), will appoint the Bidder who can manage the £120m+ of endowment portfolios as currently constituted, but with the capacity and expertise to expand the remit if required to include other classes of asset (such as private equity and infrastructure assets).  
      
      This tender is for Investment Manager only, but the University is also interested in certain additional services.  This is investment advice on a wider portfolio of assets.  To this end, a second optional section and series of questions has been included.
      This section is not compulsory, but should prospective managers answer these questions they will carry an overall weighting of 10% in the final scoring.  This is the additional value that the University places on these investment advisor services.
      However, the University does not want to dissuade interest from those only looking to manage the core endowment funds portfolio, and therefore the weighting of 90% reflects the fact that this is the key focus of the tender.

Title: London and Quadrant Housing Trust - Facade Consultant Framework 2020 - 2024 - AWARD
Description:
London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Facade Consultant for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for  Service providers only. 
      
      This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
      
      Stage 1: Selection Stage
      
      Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
      
      Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
      - Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
      - Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
      
      
      Only if you have passed the Selection Stage
      
      Stage 2: ITT Stage
      
      - Click on the 'ITT' Tab 
      - Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
      - Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
      
      Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. 
      
      
      Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact Group Procurement for information as this Tender has been created by the Framework Buying Department.

Title: Civic Centre Feasibility Sudy
Description:
To undertake a 2-Phase Feasibility Study to (i) investigate, identify and verify the current condition of the existing Civic Centre building and ascertain the implementation timescales and associated costs to ensure the building is safe and compliant in the short term, and (ii) undertake the detailed Feasibility Study to identify the refurbishment and new build annexe construction and redevelopment options available to the Council to provide maximum occupancy of the building in the long term.

The multi-discipline design team will need to have substantial expertise in project design and delivery in a sensitive heritage environment, in particular significant mechanical and electrical services replacement and upgrade and structural assessment. The contract will have provisions to break at any RIBA work stage.

Organisation Name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS)
Title: Technical Adviser for the Climate Finance Accelerator Programme
Description:
The Department for Business Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) intends to appoint a Technical Advisor (TA) to assist with the design, set-up and implementation of a new International Climate Finance programme, the Climate Finance Accelerator (CFA), which is set to be launched in 2020.   
      The CFA will support emerging economies to translate their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) - commitments made under the Paris Agreement - into 'climate investment plans', which consist of a pipeline of bankable, low-carbon projects. A series of pilot activities were undertaken from 2017 until present to test the CFA concept and a Delivery Partner (DP) will be procured within the coming months to lead programme implementation. Details about this will be disclosed in due course. Under the supervision of the BEIS programme team, the TA will support BEIS to develop the specification for, and to procure, the CFA DP, and they will subsequently oversee and support programme delivery.

Title: Provision of a Healthwatch and Independent Health Complaints Advocacy (IHCA) Service
Description:
Buckinghamshire County Council wish to commission a Healthwatch and Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service. 

The Healthwatch and Independent Health Complaints Advocacy (IHCA) Service is a new contract being commissioned by Buckinghamshire County Council which aligns the activities and outcomes of four previous contracts delivering Healthwatch, Community Engagament, IMCA and Dignity in Care (Enter and View). Residents of Buckinghamshire will be supported and engaged by the Service Provider to feed their experiences of service delivery to influence operational and strategic change within the Health and Social Care system. 

The contract start date is 1st April 2020. The contract term is 3 years with the option to extend for two further years. 

The budget for this service is £279,911 per annum.

Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (TUPE) may apply to this contract.

If your organisation wishes to participate in this process, you need to register with the Buckinghamshire Business Portal.  You will be unable to take part if you do not register. Please use the link below and follow the instructions on the website:

www.supplybucksbusiness.org.uk

Title: HPF3 SOUTH SUDAN: INVITATION OF BIDS FOR THE PROVISION OF SERVICES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF A HOUSEHOLD HEALTH SURVEY USING LQAS
Description:
The third phase of the Health Pooled Fund (HPF3) is a five-year programme, that commenced in October 2018 with funding from the Department for International Development (DFID), the Government of Canada, the Swedish International Development and Cooperation Agency (SIDA) and United States Agency for International Development (USAID), and the Global Vaccine Alliance (GAVI).
The impact of HPF3 programme will be an improved health and nutrition status for the population that saves lives and reduces morbidity (including maternal, infant and under-5 mortality).

Crown Agents Limited as the leader of the consortium managing the HPF, invites bidders (Consultants) for the implementation of a household health survey to provide data for a baseline and tracking of six (6) key health indicators as described in Table 1 of the Terms of Reference,  using the Lot Quality Assurance Sampling (LQAS) method in eight (8) of the ten (10) former states of the Republic of South Sudan.

This is a full and open competitive invitation for bids, under which any type of organisation, large or small, commercial (for profit) firms, faith-based, and non-profit organisations, either independently, or in partnership or consortia, is eligible to participate. Nonetheless, HPF encourages partnership with local, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), faith-based organisations (FBOs) and community-based organisations (CBOs) in order to build local capacity and ensure long term sustainability, however this is not a requirement.

Interested bidders may apply for bidding documents in writing to the following email address: RFP@hpfsouthsudan.org

Title: 1-968 DfT Research on performance test procedures for petroleum road fuel tankers; Part B, physical testing and associated modelling
Description:
The Department for Transport Dangerous Goods Division (DGD) intends to let a contract for the provision of research into the development of performance-based safety standards for petroleum road fuel tankers, using a combination of physical impact testing and validated, computer-based modelling/simulation software. It is anticipated that the outputs from this research will underpin UK proposals for test procedures to be included in the relevant standards and/or regulations.
DGD leads on the policy for the safe and secure carriage of dangerous goods by road and rail and has oversight of the sea and air modes. Goods that are classified as hazardous are vital to our economy and a modern way of life, and can include chemicals for industry, fuel for transport and to heat and light our homes, or batteries which power our electric devices.  Movement of such goods is essential, but it must be carried out in a way which minimises the risk of harm to people, property or the environment. 
The Division's objective is therefore to ensure that the regulations continue to safeguard the carriage of dangerous goods, but in a manner that is proportionate and does not needlessly hinder trade. The division also exists to ensure that the UK compliance and enforcement framework is as effective as possible.
The DGD research programme derives from recent experience with non-compliant petrol tankers which could have led to the failure of some fuel deliveries. The programme supports implementation of lessons learned and further proportionate improvements to the design, construction, testing and inspection of tankers, so as to reduce the risk of non-compliance and avoid further issues. It will also support the UK negotiating position at international standards fora, minimising the risk of disproportionate regulations and backing the UK interest.

Title: 1-962 Asset Management Strategic Delivery Partner (AMSDP) Contract
Description: 1.1	Highways England is an asset rich organisation with significant investment in creating, maintaining and operating our infrastructure assets to enable safe and reliable journeys for our customers.  We have a long-term vision for developing and improving our approach to asset management. In summer 2017 we developed an Informed Asset Management Plan (IAMP) that describes Highways England's overall approach for end-to-end asset management. The objective of the Plan was to assist in ensuring the effective and efficient delivery of Highways England's three imperatives of Safety, Customer Service and Delivery through asset management. The IAMP has been a critical tool in communicating our vision, working on our priorities and building our asset management capability.

Title: London and Quadrant Housing Trust - James Hardie Building Products (Merchant) Framework Tender 2020 - 2024 - AWARD
Description:
London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Concrete Weatherboarding Merchants for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for Merchants of James Hardie Building Products only. Rebates will be required. 
      
      **THIS TENDER WILL BE FOR JAMES HARDIE BUILDING PRODUCTS ONLY AS THEY ARE THE SOLUS SUPPLIER FOR L&Q'S FIBRE CEMENT CLADDING MANUFACTURER FRAMEWORK **
      
      This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
      
      Stage 1: Selection Stage
      
      Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
      
      Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
      - Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
      - Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
      
      
      ONLY IF YOU HAVE PASSED THE SELECTION STAGE 
      
      Stage 2: ITT Stage
      
      - Click on the 'ITT' Tab 
      - Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
      - Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
      
      Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. 
      
      
      Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact...

Under Regulation 72(1) (c ) of the Public Contracts Regulations Holy Trinity Academy Telford have decided to defer the contract start date for the provision of catering services to the School. It is anticipated that the contract start date will be 1st April 2021.
This decision has been made on the basis that due to Covid 19 and restrictions made by Central Government the contracting authority was unable to commence the delivery of the contract during the lockdown. 
Whilst it is recognised that this situation may change prior to 1st April 2021 there remains uncertainty around customer participation levels during the pandemic and a potential second wave which may result in further closures.
It is felt that an April 2021 start date would reduce any further issues around service delivery and gives the appointed Contractor a full Year of trading .
